sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The life, and raigne of King Edward the Sixt Written by Sr. Iohn Hayward Kt. Dr. of Lawe. Hayward, John, Sir, 1564?-1627. Vaughan, Robert, engraver.
[6], 179, [1] p. : port.
printed [by Eliot's Court Press, and J. Lichfield at Oxford?] for Iohn Partridge, and are to be sold at the signe of the Sunne in Paules Churchyard, London : [1630]
The title page is engraved and signed: Ro: Vaughan fecit. Date of publication from colophon. "Lichfield app[arently]. pr[inted]. A-X; Eliot's Court Press the prelims. and possibly Y-Z and cancels"--STC. L3, M3, N3, and Q4 are cancels, printed in slightly smaller types. Variant 1: these leaves are cancellanda. Running title reads: The life and raigne of K. Edward the sixth. Variant 2: with added letterpress title page, undated. Copies of variant 2 otherwise lacking preliminaries may represent a reissue by Partridge [1638?] to be issued with STC 12997a (STC addendum). Identified as and bound following 12997a.5 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1475-1640", reel 1989. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library, Cambridge, Massachusetts. Identified by ESTC as STC (2nd ed.) 12998.
=======

printed [by Eliot's Court Press, and J. Lichfield at Oxford?] for Iohn Partridge, and are to be sold at the signe of the Sunne in Paules Churchyard, London : [1630]
The title page is engraved and signed: Ro: Vaughan fecit. Date of publication from colophon. "Lichfield app[arently]. pr[inted]. A-X; Eliot's Court Press the prelims. and possibly Y-Z and cancels"--STC. L3, M3, N3, and Q4 are cancels, printed in slightly smaller types. Variant 1: these leaves are cancellanda. Running title reads: The life and raigne of K. Edward the sixth. Variant 2: with added letterpress title page, undated. Copies of variant 2 otherwise lacking preliminaries may represent a reissue by Partridge [1638?] to be issued with STC 12997a (STC addendum). Identified as and bound following 12997a.5 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1475-1640", reel 1989. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library, Cambridge, Massachusetts. Identified by ESTC as STC (2nd ed.) 12998.

the signe of the Sunne in Paules Churchyard
